text: I'm having trouble with an old version of local package that keeps reappearing. Is there a hidden cache somewhere that is preventing Pkg from getting the current code? I've deleted the copy in the v1.5 environment folder but it keeps coming back.

elements.text: I'm having trouble with an old version of local package that keeps reappearing. Is there a hidden cache somewhere that is preventing Pkg from getting the current code? I've deleted the copy in the v1.5 environment folder but it keeps coming back.

text: Not sure where that is. I don't see it in /.julia

text: by `it keeps coming back`, do you mean you keep using a local package? why don't you just remove it by `]rm` and add the general registry version by `]add `

elements.text: , do you mean you keep using a local package? why don't you just remove it by
and add the general registry version by `]add `

text: No, I'm trying to keep using the local package, which I've modified since the first time I added it. It isn't in the registry.

elements.text: No, I'm trying to keep using the local package, which I've modified since the first time I added it. It isn't in the registry.

text: Did you use `add` where you should have used `dev` maybe?
I honestly haven't figured out the difference between the two commands.

elements.text: I honestly haven't figured out the difference between the two commands.

text: The intent is that this unregistered package will be distributed with a Pluto notebook in a subdirectory, and the notebook needs to load it, which I'm doing with "Pkg.add("../.."). But it's not picking up my changes despite closing the Julia session, so there's an old copy somewhere it's working from instead, right?

elements.text: The intent is that this unregistered package will be distributed with a Pluto notebook in a subdirectory, and the notebook needs to load it, which I'm doing with "Pkg.add("../.."). But it's not picking up my changes despite closing the Julia session, so there's an old copy somewhere it's working from instead, right?

text: add picks up the latest commit, not the current state, of a local folder.

elements.text: add picks up the latest commit, not the current state, of a local folder.
